job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
About Us
Qualio is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) startup that is the first cloud quality management software for the entire Life Sciences ecosystem. Medical device and pharmaceutical companies need a secure and scalable quality management system with the flexibility to support their evolving needs. Qualio meets that challenge by cutting through the complexity to optimize and automate critical quality processes.
The Qualio team is all-remote, and currently distributed across North America and Europe.
What is the opportunity?
We are hiring a Site Reliability Engineer to join our distributed engineering team. The Site Reliability Engineer will be responsible for the availability, performance, and security of all Qualio applications, as well as the tooling used by the engineering teams.
What will I be doing?
Site Reliability Engineers at Quailo have a breadth of knowledge encompassing all aspects of service delivery. They develop solutions to enhance, harden and support systems reliability and developer velocity. This can include building and managing deployment pipelines, automated testing, capacity planning, performance analysis, security, monitoring and alerting, chaos engineering and auto remediation.
Site Reliability Engineers must have a passion for learning and evolving with current technology trends. They strive to innovate and are relentless in their pursuit of a flawless customer experience. They have an “automate everything” mindset and follow Site Reliability Engineering best practices, helping our company deploy services with incredible speed, consistency and availability.
Who are you?
You live and work in a country without visa restrictions
You have strong written and verbal communication skills (in English)
You have over 5 years of professional experience
You are passionate about problem solving and automation
Responsibilities
Champion automation to reduce toil and increase developer velocity
Define and implement availability, performance, and security standards working closely with engineering and business leaders
Support complex cloud native infrastructure projects and other technology initiatives in support of our business priorities while ensuring standards, frameworks, and security requirements are met
Engage with development and quality teams to create, and update policies, standards, and procedures, developing creative solutions, clarifying them when questions arise and tracking risk acceptance
Assess the needs of a system or team and make a case for prioritization of that work.
Help define and implement Service Level Objectives and Indicators to ensure highly reliable systems
Required Skills
Prior experience with containerization, security processes, standards, and strategies
Experience with release management, testing, and CI/CD pipelines
Experience working with AWS services including CloudWatch Events, Lambda, DynamoDB (DDB), Aurora RDS, SNS, SQS, CloudWatch, Elasticache
Proficiency in relational databases (PostgreSQL is preferred)
Experience maintaining and administering Elasticsearch, Containers / Docker
Strong network fundamentals and web/cloud security themes including TLS cert management, security group configuration and VPC management best practices
Strong experience with Agile Development in at least one scripting language (Go, python, bash, ruby)
Kindness. Collaboration skills. Willing to celebrate others
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Desired Skills
Cloud native container management tools: Docker, kubernetes/EKS, service mesh, Ingress controllers
Experience configuring an ELK stack for log management (splunk)
Observability/metrics experience (prometheus, grafana)
config management tool proficiency (Ansible, puppet or other)
Distributed message bus experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ
Proxies and load balancing (nginx, HAproxy, ALB/NLB)
Experience programming with python and building custom lambdas
Benefits
In addition to playing an important role in building Qualio, you'll receive:
Competitive salary
Flexible holidays
Unlimited PTO
Professional development budget
Working space allowance / home office budget
Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market
If this sounds like you, feel free to apply or reach out to me at ed.ocarroll@qualio.com
